item.title: Do some parties need to mobilize the base to win elections?
item.description: I recently posted a working paper showing how to decompose overall volatility in election results into party switching, turnout switching and population replacement. I showed that across 104 election pairs, party switching was the most important factor for electoral change in 97% of cases. This flies in the face of a lot of conventional wisdom that there are no swing voters and that elections are won by energizing the base.
